I remember watching Inspector Gadget when I was little and was excited when my little ones wanted to watch it. Bought it for the longest time that was the only thing my youngest one wanted to watch. They still watch it like they have never seen it before.
As a fan of the original cartoons, I decided to give this a try. I also like both of these actors and wanted to see how the concept would translate to live action. Absolutely loved both of them.

I purchased this item as a Valentine's Day present for my brother and am so glad I did. We had just watched the VHS copy we have of the first Inspector Gadget movie and was once again reminded how much better DVD is than VHS. I decided to order it for my brother for Valentine's Day and was very excited to see that I could get both movies for such a reasonable price. My brother has watched both of them and loves them. The quality is great and it arrived on time and in good shape. Very satisfied!

My grandchildren love these movies.  They have watched them several times, and I'm sure they will watch them many times.  I remember how much my children loved the cartoon of Inspector Gadget years ago.
Who doesn't love Inspector Gadget! Two for one! Came within the time frame. I am happy. The condtion of the case and dvds it great. Thank you.

Both movies are equally great in two different ways, the second one is more over the top than the first one but it didn't make the movie any less funny, the first one has more story but is still funny. While they will never be confused with high art or favorably compared to modern blockbusters like 'The Avengers', Inspector Gadget and Inspector Gadget 2 are fun movies to watch and perfect for family viewing. The production values appear fine, and while the special effects may appear outdated, the performances have a lot of heart behind them.

The first movie does take quite a few liberties with the original Saturday morning cartoon, but the sequel is nearly spot on in it's portrayal of the Inspector Gadget cartoon. Both Matthew Broderick and French Stewart make wonderful Inspectors in their respective movies.

At the end of the day, both movies are entertaining and will provide a pleasant afternoon's distraction for both kids and nostalgic adults alike.
